meanings.definition: Existing or operating below the threshold of consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The subliminal message in the movie was so sneaky that most people didn't even notice it.
meanings.sent2: The subliminal advertising on the billboard influenced people without them realizing it.
meanings.sent3: The subliminal whisper in the haunted house made the visitors jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her subliminal fear of spiders crept into her dreams at night.
meanings.sent5: The subliminal sound of waves crashing on the shore lulled her to sleep.

meanings.definition: Inadequate to produce a sensation or a perception.
meanings.sent1: The subliminal light from the distant star was too faint to be seen clearly.
meanings.sent2: The subliminal taste of the seasoning in the soup was barely noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The subliminal touch of the breeze on his skin tickled him unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her subliminal attempt at humor fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The subliminal scent of flowers in the garden filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: Below the threshold of conscious perception.
meanings.sent1: The subliminal movement of the tiny insect went unnoticed by the group.
meanings.sent2: The subliminal color change in the painting was so subtle that no one noticed it.
meanings.sent3: The subliminal taste of the secret ingredient in the cake surprised the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her subliminal smile hinted at a hidden emotion beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The subliminal scent of rain in the air signaled an approaching storm.
